content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Copper Cable Factory at position (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Cable factory input chest at position (2.5, 17.5)
– Burner inserter at position (2.5, 16.5)
– Burner inserter at position (3.5, 17.5) using direction RIGHT
– Assembling machine at position (1.5, 19.5)

### Belt Depot System at position (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Wooden chest placed at position (3.5, 15.5) to serve as a belt depot
– Dedicated transport belt segment at position (4.5, 15.5) adjacent to the depot chest
– Depot burner inserter at position (3.5, 14.5) using direction UP

### Extraction System at position (-3.5, 27.5)
Consists of the following entity:
– Extraction system burner inserter at position (–3.5, 27.5) with drop position (–3.5, 28.5)

ERROR TIPS

• Transport Belt Connection Errors
  – When connecting transport belts, the target must be a valid inserter rather than a steam engine. Repeated failures occurred because transport belts were attempted to be connected directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine object. Always insert an intermediary inserter to input items into the steam engine.

• Entity Placement Issues
  – Placement errors for the wooden chest were observed due to the target position being too far from the player and a lack of the required item in inventory. To avoid these issues, move sufficiently close to the target location and verify that the necessary entity is available in the inventory before attempting placement.

• Undefined Variable Reference
  – A NameError arose from using an undefined variable (target_chest). Ensure that all variables are declared properly and referenced consistently prior to use.
